name: Bejeweled Twist
description: Spin, match, explode... WOW! It's a brilliant new way to play Bejeweled! Get set for a vivid sensory rush as you spin and match explosive gems for shockwaves of fun. Rotate jewels freely to set up electrifying combos, outwit surprising obstacles like Locks and Bombs, and create high-voltage Flame and Lightning gems.
minimum_requirements: Supported OS: Windows XP/Vista                    DirectX Version: DirectX 8 or later                    Processor: 1.2GHz processor                    Memory: 256MB of RAM (512+MB recommended)                    Graphics Card: DirectX-compatible video with 32MB of video memory                    Sound: DirectX Compatible Sound Card                    Hard Drive: 250MB of free hard drive space

reviews.review_text: More addictive than drinking Coca Cola. ZEN mode is %100 full of win.  10 Out of 10!

There's something so satisfying when I twist these pretty gems and watch them explode. The obvious secret to getting the big points is to have consecutive matches, and also to take advantage of the bonuses. My high score in Classic Mode is 1,489,570. In Zen mode I'm at level 51, but that doesn't mean anything, because you can't lose in that mode. (is it ok to brag while reviewing a game? I have no idea) and it's a fun challenge trying to beat my best score. A few of my friends think this game is silly, but they seem to not be able to get their head around the simplicity of the twisting manipulation. The people who get this game are usually able to see 3 or 4 steps ahead, and those are the folks that usually have fun with this game. (That's not a rule, just something I've noticed) Sound effect, which mostly consist of incresingly intense explosions, are a blast. Dumb pun, but I had to do it. When I look at my hours played, it makes me think I may need Bejeweled Twist Rehab. Get myself a BT 30 chip. Or maybe just switch addictions.
It's Bejeweled, with a Twist.  WITH SPACE BACKGROUNDS.
I really love this game I can play for hours and still love it, it has great realaxing music and great graphics.
